intro: Pseudolachnostoma sucrense, commonly known as the Sucrenses pseudolachnostoma, is a rare and specialized plant found in specific high-altitude environments. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late summer. It thrives in cool, moist conditions and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
